div.p: To the Secretary of the Pharmaceutical Society of New South Wales

Letter not found. For the text given here, see ‘Letter from Baron von Mueller’, in the report of the monthly meeting of the Council of the Pharmaceutical Society of New South Wales held on 16 June 1891, Pharmaceutical journal of Australasia , vol. 4, p. 126, 20 July 1891 (B91.06.01).
Melbourne, 1st June, 1891.

The Secretary of the Pharmaceutical Society.
W. T. Pinhey.
— Feel much touched honored Sir with the generous attention shown me by the President and Council of the Pharmaceutical Society of N.S.W., in connecting me so prominently with your important union.
M had been elected an honorary member of the Society at its meeting on 19 May 1891.
I appreciate this unexpected honor all the more highly because I have but such slender claims on your kindness, but let me however say, that it will at all times afford me great pleasure to co-operate with the Society as far as I can. In the rapid progress of knowledge all over the world within the later decennia the pharmaceutical profession has eminently shared and especially so in the southern Colonies where, moreover, so many subjects of novel enquiry are professionally before us. If, therefore, I can in any way be of use to you and your honored colleagues, then command unhesitatingly my services.
